* Represents the main class for the EDITH chatbot application.
* The Edith class is responsible for initializing and running the chatbot. It handles user interactions,
* processes commands, and manages the task list. The application uses the classes Ui for user interface operations,
* Storage for data persistence, TaskList for managing tasks, and Parser for interpreting user commands.
* Constructs an Edith instance with the specified file path for storage.
* Initializes the user interface, storage, task list, and command parser. Attempts to load the existing task list
* from the specified file. If an error occurs during loading, it initializes with an empty task list.
* @param filePath The path to the file where tasks are stored.

* EdithException is a custom exception class used in the EDITH chatbot application.
* It extends IllegalArgumentException to provide specific error messages related to invalid arguments or instructions.

* @param message The detail message, which is saved for later retrieval by the getMessage() method.

* A launcher class to workaround classpath issues.
* This class is required to launch the application due to certain
* limitations with launching JavaFX applications directly from an executable JAR.
* It serves as a wrapper to call the {@link Main} class, which contains the
* Main class for the Edith GUI app.
* This class extends the Application class from JavaFX to create and launch the GUI.

*
  • "list [date]" - Returns a ListOnDateCommand with the specified date.

*
  • "mark [index]" - Returns a MarkCommand with the specified task index.

*
  • "unmark [index]" - Returns a UnmarkCommand with the specified task index.

*
  • "delete [index]" - Returns a DeleteCommand with the specified task index.

*
  • "find [keyword]" - Returns a FindCommand with the specified keyword.

*
  • "todo [task]" - Returns an AddCommand to add a ToDo task.

*
  • "deadline [task] /by [dueDate]" - Returns an AddCommand to add a Deadline task.

*
  • "event [task] /from [startTime] /to [endTime]" - Returns an AddCommand to add an Event task.
* @param userInput The raw input string from the user.
* @return The corresponding Command based on the user input.
* @throws EdithException If the user input does not match any recognized command format.

* Represents an abstract base class for commands in the Edith chatbot application.
* Commands are actions that the chatbot can execute based on user input.
* This class provides a common interface for all concrete command implementations.
* Executes the command using the provided task list, user interface, and storage.
* Subclasses should implement this method to define the specific behavior of the command.
* @param tasks The list of tasks to be manipulated by the command.
* @param ui The user interface for displaying messages and prompts.
* @param storage The storage for saving and loading tasks.
* @throws EdithException If an error occurs during the execution of the command.
public abstract String execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws EdithException;
